description: gate +â€Ž keep, as back-formation from gatekeeper.

verbs.description: gatekeep (third-person singular simple present gatekeeps, present participle gatekeeping, simple past and past participle gatekept)

entries.meaning: To control or limit access to something.
(sociology) To limit (sometimes manipulatively, rather than directly) how much of a role another party, often a spouse, has in some task.
(by extension, slang, Internet) To limit another party's participation in a collective identity or activity, usually due to undue pettiness, resentment, or overprotectiveness.
